CatDescriptText: Mrs. Lillian W. Brown, 839 Clarissa Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 15, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think common-law marriage should be outlawed?" answer reads: "Very definitely. I don't think that it's good for society as a whole and know that it's not good for the children.  It tends towards more delinquency."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Lillian W. Brown, wearing light colored coat with collar, and dark hat and gloves, holding shopping bag, handbag, and bus ticket, standing in front of brick wall with barred window, pedestrians in background
